author: {'steamid': '76561198045377291', 'num_games_owned': 1687, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 758, 'last_played': 1696871782}
review:
Funny enough I do recommend this game if you like riichi-style mahjong and are already familiar with the game, but you need to know how to play going in, this is required! The game doesn't really provide a good tutorial on how to play. In my opinion no riichi-style mahjong game on Steam gives a good tutorial on how to play. You'd have a better chance learning how to play from Yakuza 0, which I recommend doing as it gives a good beginners look into the game. Not perfect though.

So the bottom line is...do you want a fast paced riichi-style mahjong game with "cute" anime girls squealing at you every 60 seconds? If yes, then get it on sale as the RRP is not worth it. If not, play Mahjong Nagomi. Mahjong Nagomi would be my favourite mahjong game on Steam if the game was a bit faster and the AI a bit smarter. Due to Mahjong Pretty Girls Battle fixing both of these issues for me, it will continue to be the primary riichi-style mahjong game for me. If you are wondering about the squealing anime girls being a problem, go into the options and mute them. Like I do...

If you are this far into my sh1tty review of this game simply because you'd like to learn how to play riichi-style mahjong. I don't know what to say...Yakuza 0 is pretty cheap (even cheaper when on sale) and the best Yakuza game ever made. So you'd could pick that up and have fun playing Yakuza 0 and then invest into the mahjong mini-game within. Watch the Akagi anime (it's what got me into riichi mahjong). The thing that taught me the most about riichi mahjong was a book called - Riichi Mahjong: The Ultimate Guide to the Japanese Game Taking the World by Storm - by the author Scott D. Miller. I couldn't follow any of the tutorials on YouTube as my attention span is abysmal, so I took my time reading that book while on lunch break at work. I'd recommend trying all three, why? Because it worked for me, I guess.

Also Tsubasa best girl, lol.

Also my favourite riichi mahjong game of all time is THE Mahjong on Switch. Seriously D3 Publisher...you need to bring that game to PC and localise it for western audiences. That games M1 mode is so good.

review:
ANTES DE COMPRAR este juego es necesario señalar algunas ADVERTENCIAS:
1. El juego consiste en hacer 4 trios y una pareja (en tu mano), es el póker de toda la vida pero con muchas fichas. Por lo que he podido observar, el 90% de las partidas se cierran por alguna que descarta la IA.
2. He leído por encima las normas del Mahjong y el problema que le veo es que hay distintos modos y lo que hace complicado este juego no es hacer mahjong, sino averiguar como se cierra porque, aunque tengas lo necesario en la mano para cerrar la ronda o la partida, no te deja, es como si hubiera que seguir determinado palo para hacerlo, sigue siendo un misterio para mí. Del segundo puesto no suelo bajar.
3. A no ser que manejes mucho el tema del mahjong (me refiero a normas) puede llevarte horas este juego, yo solo he desbloqueado 3 personajes en 7 horas, pero no me cansa, me gusta.
4. No he visto por ningún lado la opción de jugar contra alguien, solamente IA.
5. No tiene contenido sexual el juego, así que si buscas darte placer te equivocas de juego.

Punto negativo: cuando vas ganando de 8000-10000 puntos parece que ganas o empatas más partidas pero a veces no la cierra en la ronda 4, o tienes que perder la ronda o tienes que hacer mahjong.
CONCLUSIÓN:
El juego es guaay si te gustan los retos y el mahjong, enserio que es un reto constante.

review:
(This is an identical review to Mahjong Pretty Girls Battle: Schoolgirl Edition as the games are functionally identical with different characters)

This is a functional Riichi Mahjong game that has some cute anime girls as your own and the AI's characters. 

It DOES function properly and follows the rules and even has customizable options for certain hands. It however does NOTHING to teach you how to play the game. So if you don't know how to play you're just going to be very very lost. The AI speeds is stupidly fast to the point you can't even comprehend what they're doing. Doing your own actions takes an excessive amount of clicks. The translation is...questionable at best so you're not going to learn many proper terms for even English audiences of Riichi Mahjong and if you already know them...well then you're just going to be confused. 

Does the game work? Yes it does. Is it a good way to play? Very likely not because you can't learn with this and if you know how to play...you're already playing somewhere better. Only buy this if you really just want mahjong with cute anime girls (And even that can be found elsewhere).

[h1]+[/h1]
*Cute anime girls as the characters.
*It functions to the rules of Riichi Mahjong

[h1]---[/h1]
*You will not learn how to play
*The pacing is absurd and honestly broken
*Unlocking anything takes forever
*You only play against AI (That's honestly either bad or cheaty it feels at times)
*The translation is just....wow

review:
I caught the mahjong bug pretty recently and am trying a bunch of ways to play this. This is a bad way. It's got weird balance shit going on which fine if you want that conceit, but not good if you are trying to learn mahjong. On top of that it is just a very poorly put together thing. I turned the volume all the way down in the settings and it hard crashed. It feels very cheap, it does not use Riichi mahjong terms that literally every other thing I've tried uses. And it has extremely unrealistic unlock conditions for the other characters, you better be ready to grind this not so great Mahjong game. 

Its hard to really recommend many games if you just want to play Mahjong against a computer. The Yakuza series has some pretty good versions of it, Kiwami 2 and up probably specifically better than like Zero. There's also Mahjong Soul which is basically this but as a gacha game and much higher quality while being free to play, though that game is very limited options for playing against AI. review:
I mean it's just a kinda bad Riichi-Mahjong engine. Works well enough if you know the rules but if not, good luck. There are plenty of engines out there that are probably better and allow for online multiplayer, which this one does not. I'm only okay with this because it's basically free during the sale. 

If you were looking for some cute girls, good luck or better yet, don't bother. Unlocking more besides the starting 4 takes a huge amount of grind. I've played 3 hours and unlocked a single new character. You have to win a certain amount of games with one character to unlock the next in that row. The first new characters take 3 wins. Then 5, 7 and 10. There are also special unlocks like an overall of 10 & 100 games played, a certain amount of games won, won with 20 different kinds of hands etc. Not worth the grind.

Tl;dr: buy this if it's on sale for like 1-2 bucks and you don't already have an atleast decent engine to play Riichi-Mahjong, but not if you don't understand the rules. I know those last 2 points are kinda paradoxical.

review:
[h1](그나마) 좋은 부분[/h1]
- 스팀에서 찾아보기 힘든 리치 마작
- 눈에 띄는 치명적인 버그..는 일단 없는 듯

[h1]ㅈ같은 부분[/h1]
- 컨텐츠가 [b]"없음"[/b]
 (4인 CPU 대국 뿐. 게임 내 도전 과제는 형식적으로 존재하지만 스팀 연동이 안 됨)
- 전형적이며 또한 심하게 구린 캐릭터 디자인
- 차라리 없는게 나을 수준의 음성
 (한정된 상황에서만 몇 번 나오는 수준인데 음질도 개판이고 볼륨 조절도 전부 제각각)
- 최적화 개떡
- 각종 편의 기능이나 세부 설정 따위 부족
 (버림패 계산, 리치시 오름패와 역 예상, 후리텐 경고 등)
- 조작계와 인터페이스 전부 엉망진창
 (작탁 전체가 한 화면에 들어오지 않음. 스마트폰/태블릿의 조작계를 그대로 박아넣음)

[h1]스팀에서 찾아보기 힘든 리치 마작[/h1]
이라는 점 외엔 [b]"아무것도 없는"[/b] 정말 깡통같은 게임. 그나마 치명적인 버그가 산재하거나 괴상망측한 룰이 튀어나오는 사기마작도 아니라 [b]일단 게임으로서 성립[/b]하고 있다는 점은 다행이지만 멀티플레이도 없고 컨텐츠가 겨우 캐릭터 개방, 그나마도 XXX 캐릭터로 XX번 승리 같은 조건 뿐이라 오래 붙잡고 있을 의미가 없다.

캐릭터가 매력적이냐 하면 그것도 아니고, 특수효과 등으로 눈을 즐겁게 해 주느냐 하면 그것도 아니고, 심지어 심하게 버벅거리기까지 함. 캐릭터를 내세운 마작 게임이라면 최소한 화료시 역 읽어주는 정도의 성의는 있어야 할 거 아냐.

[h1]여튼[/h1]
악평이 많은 데는 그만한 이유가 있다는 걸 보여주는 게임. 오히려 이딴 게 복합적 평가가 찍혀있을 정도로 긍정 평가가 많다는 사실이 더 어이가 없을 지경. 난 꼭 스팀으로 리치 마작을 할 거야! 가 아니라면 같은 PC 플랫폼에서도 괜찮은 유/무료 게임이 넘쳐난다. 하다 못해 DLsite 에서 팔고 있는 동인 탈의 마작류 게임이 훠얼씬 나을 수준. 그건 [b]보지 보여주고 꼭지 보여주기[/b]라도 하지..

[h1]결론적으로[/h1]
정가인 16,000원에, 심지어 [b]90% 할인이 적용된다 쳐도 구입 할 만한 게임은 절대 아님[/b]. 그나마 트레이딩 카드는 지원하니 어딘가 번들에 섞여 온다면 [b]카드만 빨고 버리면 될 듯[/b].

1)キャラクターがいる必要がない。ボイスのある意味が見いだせない。ロジックに個性がない。
2)ルール変更で痒い所に手が届いていない。「先付け」「ドラの取り決め」「ダブロンの有無」「三家和の設定」「連荘の設定」がない。
3)そこまで敵が強くない。○○で△回勝つとキャラ開放という設定をしているせいか、他家がリーチしても緊張感が少ない。
割と麻雀ゲームとしては致命的な所がおざなりです。

でも、steamでは貴重な麻雀ゲーム。私は自分のGPDforWINに入れて気楽にやることにします。
真面目に麻雀が強くなるタイプのゲームではありません。

author: {'steamid': '76561198872073055', 'num_games_owned': 1052, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1671213674}
review:
[h1] [b]简评[/b][/h1]
这是一个简单的[b]单机[/b]日本麻将
[h1]优点：[/h1]
    (1) 角色和CG
    (2) 可以接受的AI
[h1]缺点：[/h1]
    (1) 只能单机，玩法单一
    (2) 大量重复游玩才能解锁人物
    (3) 设计欠佳的看牌视角（无法看到碰、吃的牌）
[h1][b]总结：[/b][/h1]
     中规中矩的单机日麻，[b]并没有任何福利[/b]。游戏形式就是一般的东风场，索性AI并不算太弱智，至少对于非核心玩家，应该都可以和AI打的有来有回。AI的技术特点就我的实力也分析不出，不过至少不是一方碾压另一方(两种情况都是)的无趣游戏体验。游戏是单机的，玩久了就会乏味，另外游戏包含了大量角色，需要玩家进行大量重复的对战才能解锁，这纯粹是恶意延长通关时间的设定，也使得游戏整体显得乏味。AI的出牌时间可以在设置里调节，再也不用担心对手长考了，不过最快的速度有点反人类，刚出完牌还没反应过来另外三家已经打完一巡又到你了。还有一点不足是视角问题，默认的视角是无法看到碰、吃下来的牌的，而有人碰、吃还会进行一段非常尴尬的视角转换。

总之这款游戏刚刚及格，也就是说我认为它差不多跟电脑自带的扫雷和纸牌接龙差不多。所以手头什么都没有的时候，而你又玩腻了扫雷，或许可以试试。这款游戏适合新手以上（不出意料这个游戏并没有新手教程）进阶玩家以下。日麻的核心玩家还是别玩这个吧。慈善包入的，作为小游戏的储备还是不错的。打折不到一折建议就不用考虑了
[h1][b]游戏时间：[/b][/h1]
     未通关
[h1][b]总评：[/b][/h1] 
    6/10

review:
Like a lot of other people I am completely new to this form of Mahjong and therefor was completely unable to play the game since it doesn't offer any kind of tutorial or training. 
The moment you start the game, you are thrown into your first round of Mahjong and basically play random tiles in hopes something good happens. However, it's not only the tutorial that is missing, even if you try to look through the 'Help' option or the 'Rules' option you aren't offered any kind of instructions on how to play. 
Players in the community themselves took it onto them to publish guides on how to actually play the game.

However, me being unable to play simply because I don't know the rules, doesn't justify me giving a bad review of a game since it can be a good experience for others who actually do know how to play. I did read through some of the other reviews though and it seems that even players with experience struggle with some aspects of the game and therefor I stick with the bad review since I myself can't recommend it (at least for newbies) and experienced players also seem too struggle with a recommendation. 

Do not recommend, unless you are already feeling at home with the rules of Mahjong.

review:
このレビューを見た人はこれだけは守ってほしい。
[b]【定価で手を出すな】[/b]

いずれセールで90%OFFが来る。
四季セールや、ハロウィンか、ゲリラか…
3か月後とかかもしれないがいずれは来る。
しかもSCHOOL GIRL EDISIONも一緒に90%になる。
抱き合わせパックを買えば更に安くなり、２つで350円ぐらいになる。

いいか、
[b]【定価で手を出すな】[/b]

以下レビュー

[h1]ギャグの領域[/h1]

・麻雀自体に期待はハナからしてないが…

麻雀×美少女と言うジャンルは大昔から確立されたジャンルで、
後者の美少女の方に重点が置かれることが多く
内部では確率操作をして実質ご褒美だけなゲームも古くから存在している。

そこを踏まえてこのゲームを見たとしていても
タイトル通りギャグの領域でしかない。

理由としてはこうだ。

ゲームについてに記載されている
"私が美少女麻雀No.1よ！"なんていう[b]設定は無い[/b]
つまり、ストーリーがない。
淡々と使ったキャラと対戦するキャラを選んで麻雀をするだけ。
またキャラクターも４，５枚のカットインが存在するだけであり、
あとは、緑色の卓に牌を投げる図だけとなる。
正直、麻雀を盛り上げる要素かどうかは疑問。

と言うより"盛り上げるボイス！"に記載されてる。
"鳴き、ツモなどのボイスはもちろんのこと、勝利したとき、悲しいとき"
ぐらいしか[b]ボイスが無い。[/b]
しかも元ネタのR-18ゲームのボイスから抜き取ったので、
キャラの受け答えが謎。

麻雀のAIとしても貧弱さが目立ち。
ロン出来る状態でも、意味のない見逃しをする場合が多い。
無意味な思考に麻雀理論は無用。実力を試すも何もない。

またカンをしたところを見たことが無い。
つまり槍積が恐らく出来ないのではないか？ぐらいまで疑っているぐらい。

あと親の上がり止めが無いです。強制で２本場へ行きます。
なのでオーラス親トップでタンヤオ！逃げ切った！
２本場・・・は？っとなります。
様々な麻雀ゲームでオーラすの親トップ上がりはそこでゲーム終了なので
違和感が有りますが、ルール的には有るようです…。

・億劫なキャラ解放ゲー

キャラクターが全部で23人居る中、最初の4人以外は
ゲームプレイで条件を満たして解放していきます。

条件のほとんどが「〇〇のキャラを使って1位をX回取る」、
と言う物であり、
もし、気に入ったキャラクターが居たとしても、
解放の為に別に好みでないキャラクターを半強制で使わされる事となる。

ちなみにX回は「3,5,7,10回〇〇のキャラを使って1位を取る」となっており、
初期キャラ3回→先ほど解放されたキャラで5回→更に解放された…と言う仕組み
つまりほぼ全てのキャラクターを使って1位を取る必要がある。
（10回目で解放されるキャラには次のキャラ条件が無い為扱わずとも良い）
いくらAIがポンコツとは言え10回勝利は地獄である。
3順即リー、一発ツモの負け試合も当然あるためである。
焼き鳥上等。
→オプションで点数と２局（東風の半分）、東風、半荘を選べます。
　作業ゲーに飽きたら、最低点&２局を選んで即飛ばしで1位をもぎ取る作業へ。
　
また、〇種の役で和了、100回勝つ、100回プレイと言う特殊なキャラも居るので
全部の解放には非常に時間がかかります。

*-------------------------------------------------*
総評：
-30点　（-100～+100の範囲の評価です。）

麻雀ゲームとしてもAIが謎。
美少女麻雀としても見せたい部分が謎。
ストアページで見たあの子良いな！使いたい！と言う欲求も打ち消す作業。

そしてフルプライスが2300円と言う始末。
妥当な値段にしては1000円以下だと思いますし、無料ゲームの方が強いし、
カスタムでキャラクター追加やボイス追加したりできるゲームも有るし…。
んで、steamの実績も無い。（カードやバッチは有る）

麻雀・美少女、どっちの方面でも期待が出来ないゲームでした。

author: {'steamid': '76561198413987657', 'num_games_owned': 3035, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1519952369}
review:
So, let me start of by saying that I love Mahjong. As in, actual Mahjong, not the tile matching version that most people I ask think IS Mahjong. It's a game my family has been playing many times over, to the point that it's become kind of a staple game that we even bring on holiday trips. However, we obviously don't play it the 'proper' way. We had a small, older book explaining various rules etc, but we still played relatively casual. No 30k points combos for us, haha.

Why am I including this in my review? We'll, I've been itching for some time to play the real game, to learn the combos, the tricks, the various rules, basically to step my game up and deepen my knowledge about this family favourite. More often than not, when I was looking for a computer version, I ended up with the solitaire version instead. So, finding the actual game was like a breath of fresh air. I didn't get it for the pretty girls specifically but I figured they wouldn't hurt the fun either.

Thing is, there aren't really any instructions. I knew from the family session what a Pung or Kong were etc, but I had no idea why certain other things were happening, what melding was, any of that. I still had fun playing but I was still a casual playing against AIs who knew what they were doing.

It was helpful that the game auto-alerts you to when a discarded tile is usable for you, since it'll get harder to spot the more crowded the board gets. But there was no guidance otherwise. Each of the girls even has different AI operatives with different strengths and preferences that I wouldn't even know how to counter because I had no idea what they were to begin with. So unless you know your Mahjong, you're probably better off picking a different game that has some explanations. I'd wanna give a neutral thumb since I still had fun playing despite not knowing what to do in detail, but since it can be only one or the other... I suppose if it was a little cheaper I'd recommend, but at this price I can't whole-heartedly do so. Maybe the price is proportionate to cup size inside... I'll probably never find out XD

All of these girls are characters from various Visual Novels, so if there's one you've taken a liking to you're in luck since she'll be in at least one other game (and potentially in another game like this one). Although I can't guarantee that you'll like what you'll find... or maybe you will. Look them up at your own risk if you're so inclined.

review:
Mahjong pretty girls battle :
Note : 1/5
Mahjong pretty girls battle est un jeu de Mahjong, mais attention car il s'agit de la version qui se joue à quatre et qui n'a donc rien à voir avec les pyramides de la version solitaire. Je croyais y discerner quelques similitudes mais excepté qu'il s'agit des mêmes dominos, le lien de parenté s'arrête là.
J'ai donc essayé une première partie et je n'ai strictement rien compris à ce qu'il se passait. M'armant de courage et souhaitant jouer avec de nouvelles camarades de jeu somptueuses, j'ai cherché sur Youtube des vidéos de tutoriels. Après visionnage, j'ai compris les bases, j'ai relancé... Et ce n'était pas suffisant pour remporter une partie... J'ai de nouveau tenté de comprendre les règles avancée mais j'ai jeté l'éponge car je crois qu'il est préférable de s'initier avec de vrais joueurs autour d'une vraie table. Le défaut majeur de ce Mahjong pretty girls battle, c'est qu'il y a certes des règles dans les options mais pas de didacticiel interactif ni même de mode de difficulté. Donc, je n'ai jamais vraiment compris si je perdais parce que je ne maitrisais pas toutes les subtilités ou si le jeu était tout simplement trop dur.
En m'accrochant un peu, j'ai réussi à gagner 2 parties, juste assez pour comprendre qu'il n'y avait pas grand chose à se mettre sous la dent. On débloque des personnages mais rien de plus, pas d'animations, pas d'images bonus.
Là encore, pas de multi, pas de hot seat.
Au final, un jeu décevant qui aurait mérité un peu plus d'effort de la part des développeurs pour le rendre accessible au plus grand nombre en proposant davantage d'aide.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101974519', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1506648814}
review:
After giving poor ratings this morning to a couple of other games in the "Pretty Girls" series (Mahjong Solitaire and Poker Battle), I was very pleasantly surprised by this one. Japanese (Riichi) mahjong is very different from the solitaire tile game, and it's even harder to find a good digital version. This one is actually decent, with a few caveats. First, don't attempt this complex game if you don't know the rules, because you won't learn them here. There is no tutorial, and the only available help is in a few sentences of poorly translated text. In the How to Play section, for example, you'll read this: "It lifts when hand tile is done in the click once. When the same tile is done in the click again, it throws it away to the place." And in the actual Rules section (which really just outlines the options available in this version), you'll find this example: "East round, leader is changed When leader is no ready hand." 

If you're already familiar with Riichi mahjong, then you'll find the action here to be pretty fast, and the controls are intuitive. All special moves (such as chi, pon, and kan) and the dora are completely automated. There are a couple of features I'd like to see implemented. For example, you cannot arrange the tiles in your hand (that's also automated), and there is no confirmation for normal moves. More than once I've accidentally got rid of the wrong tile by clicking too fast, but these are really minor complaints. A bigger complaint is that the game itself is not configurable. You can't, for example, alter the number of hands in each round, so you're stuck with the standard 4-hand-2-round game, which will take you a while. (Saving mid-game doesn't seem to be an option, either. EDIT: The game supposedly autosaves on exit, but it hasn't worked for me.) Sounds and music are well done, and there are even video resolutions available, which is a rarity in this series. Unfortunately, it lacks multiplayer, but you can find that on several browser-based versions if that's your thing. Because of the solo-only play and lack of game configuration options, the current price point of US $15 is about $5 too high, but it's frequently on sale and has been bundled twice already. Wait for a sale, and then pick it up. Recommended.

For those of you who would like to learn how to play this ancient and addictive game, I recommend this excellent video by HanaYoriUta: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hlnC2rgIPrc 
It's 3.5 hours long, but you'll be able to play fairly well after watching the first hour.

review:
It's a great mahjong game if you want a straight and authentic game of mahjong. The cute girls are there for show, the main focus of this game is the mahjong game itself.

If you are completely new to mahjong and are looking to learn (like myself), then it's much better to go online and look for a tutorial and a list of yaku rather than poking around and hope you pick it up as you go along. First of all, the computer is quite good and you probably wont figure out how to properly win a hand because the computer will always win before you can learn anything. Secondly, the names of the yaku in English are strange or badly translated. You wont know what yaku you have until the end of the match and they have the strangest names, making it hard to search up online to see how or what the combination was.

All in all, it's a great game if you already know how to play, or if you are learning, but already know the basic rules. If you know some basic Japanese, then it's much better to switch the language to Japanese so you can get the names of the yaku at the end and look them up for reference.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980516413', 'num_games_owned': 1075, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1486158733}
review:
[i]Я не игрок в маджонг. Мой уровень знания этой настольной игры перед знакомством с [b]Mahjong Pretty Girls Battle[/b] был примерно "это что-то типа домино скрещенное с покером?" Я рассматривал игру именно с той позиции, как если бы захотел научиться играть в маджонг и понадеялся, что в группе с тянками обучение будет веселее.[/i] 

[h1]ОЦЕНКА*[/h1][url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=412623516]*Что означает каждая оценка? А также полный список всех моих обзоров можно увидеть кликнув по этому тексту.[/url] 
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=837949785 
[h1]РАЗБОР ИГРЫ[/h1] 
И первое разочарование в том, что [b]Mahjong Pretty Girls Battle[/b]  абсолютно не сможет вас научить играть в маджонг. 
Какого либо режима с обучением нет, а короткая памятка в пару абзацев объясняет всё очень поверхностно и опуская все детали. 
В игре применяется японская разновидность маджонга или как его называют риичи-маджонг. Со своими тонкостями, дополнительными наборами костей и возможностями строить из них комбинации. Но узнал я это только благодаря брату Гуглу. 

Не знакомому с маджонгом человеку придётся очень сложно, так как игра идёт не просто на выкидывание фишек, а именно на правильное составление своей руки для максимального выигрыша. 
Что и какая комбинация значит никто вам не будет объяснять. Кто хоть раз начинал играть в покер поймут меня, ведь там обязательно знание комбинаций, а когда ты даже представления не имеешь что и как, то планировать сложно.  

При этом на изначальных настройках [b]Mahjong Pretty Girls Battle[/b] абсолютно не настроена на то, чтобы дать вам играть самому. Все 3 противника будут ходить за секунду, а помощник услужливо будет останавливать игру в нужные вам моменты и предлагать варианты. 
Можно выключить помощника, но я голову себе разбил, как в нужной мне ситуации применять нужные кости. Перенажимал все кнопки на клавиатуре, проделал все возможные пассы мышкой, всё без толку. 
Игра сводится к тому, что сидишь и выкидываешь кости по принципу "минимум навредить себе", а всё остальное делает за тебя игра. 

Возможности игры по онлайну нет, а оффлайновые стычки не отличаются особыми интересом из-за выше названных особенностей. 
Внешне игра выглядит как серые будни клерка, что через год решится покончить жизнь самоубийством. Стол обтянут какой-то грязной текстурой, да фишки о 6 полигонах - всё, что мы видим. 
От музыки мозг начинает вытeкать через уши уже спустя час игры. 
Не спецэффектов, не анимации. Всё очень топорно и уступает по качеству какому нибудь [b]Midnight Hold'em Poker[/b] от [b]Gameloft[/b], что вы запускали на своём Nokia N95. 
Ну и самое главное: очень скучно нарисованные 2D-тян разрешением на 10 шакалов. 
Всего в игре 23 барышни из которых изначально открыто 4. Остальные, в большинстве, открываются победами за уже открытых тянок. 

Кастомизации героинь нет, характеры толком не прописаны, объяснения кто и откуда тоже нет, раздевать нельзя, даже группу крови для каждой не написали. Как в таких условиях порядочному человеку найти себе вайфу - непонятно. 

[h1]Новичкам будет сложно, опытным скучно. Фапать на местных, вопящих в ультразвуковых частотах, мыльных тян: сложно даже отаку. Как результат - бесполезная игра. [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198033624455', 'num_games_owned': 782, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2807, 'last_played': 1702423677}
review:
The name might seem a little off-putting for some, but if you want to delve into Japanese-style mahjong then this is pretty much the only option on Steam right now. The "Schoolgirl edition" is the same game just with a different skin. 

GAMEPLAY

In terms of Riichi rules, the options menu allows you to configure the ruleset to your preference (length of game, red 5's, particular Yaku's etc). 

The AI of each character is set to prefer a particular playstyle, to take extra risks in attack or be safer in defense, to favour melds or triplets etc. 

Game progression is measured through unlocking characters, so you basically play each character to win a set number of times and unlock the next character. All the while the detailed stats page will keep track of all your results so that say after 50 or so games you will be able to analyse your playstyle.  

There is also a list of in-game achievements but these are not rendered in Steam. 


SOUND AND LOOKS

There are two language options, Japanese or English. The English translation is not very well rendered and does not seem to have been done by a native speaker. You should be able to figure it out though. 

The 23 playable characters consist of happy picture & sound clip, and a sad one. That's it - you might find one or two annoying after a bit but if you keep your opponents randomised then you won't notice as much. There's nothing inappropriate for say ages 15 & over - some of the characters have revealing clothes or a large busom and that's that. 

The music is OK but very repetitive. A couple of extra tracks could have made this much better.

The playfield is excellently rendered. You have a couple of options for viewpoints and table colour, and the display style is clear and intuitive. The tiles are neatly differentiated. 


CONCLUSION

Mahjong Pretty Girls Battle is, at heart, a solid one-player Riichi Mahjong game which you can trust to bring your skills up to scratch, Beyond that, there's no multiplayer, so you will need to use this to "graduate" towards a web-based title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055530890', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 709, 'last_played': 1653318383}
review:
Honestly, I could go either way with this game. Here's the short version: If you know how to play Riichi Mahjong already, and want a classic 4-player Mahjong game to play on Steam by yourself, go ahead and buy this.

Here's the long version. This game has no tutorial or help system at all, so unless you have a deep understanding of how Japanese Mahjong works, you will be pretty lost at this game. It also has no multiplayer system of any kind - you can only play with CPU players. I personally have no problem with that, but I know a few people who do, so I'm mentioning that.

There's really not a whole lot to this game actually. You can change the rules to some degree, but it has no special features, so honestly, I find the game a little bit overpriced. But given how there are no other games on Steam like this (at the time this review was written), I'm still happy that this at least exists. You can either love it or hate it. Me, personally? I'd play it, but it's not real special. It does what it says on the box, but that's about it.

And by the way, if you know of any other games like this on Steam (excluding Tabletop Simulator), please comment on this review to tell me about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155838928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 982, 'last_played': 1536239756}
review:
様々なAI麻雀ゲームをプレイしてきたのですが、粗方やり尽くしてしまいここ最近AIキャラとの対局に重きを置いたとされるゲームがコレしかなかったため、不評を承知で90％引きセールで購入しました。ですがこれほどのプライスオフを以ってしても、遊んでみて落胆を禁じえませんでした。

●魅力的…？な女の子達
ボイスについては「少ない」「麻雀関係ない」「聞いてて不快な台詞多い」と明らかに欠点だらけです。充実してません、盛り上がりません。「さっさと消え失せなさーい」はまだ良い方です。アガリを取られてげんなりしてる所を「私の事、好きよねぇぇ↑ー！？」ってどう反応しろと…他にも自分の名前(花音)とかけて「×××カノン、お見舞いしちゃう」みたいな寒い台詞を長々と喋るキャラもいます。たかが鳴く度に。このように台詞が無茶苦茶なのは、他の方も書いてらっしゃる通り、アダルトゲームのキャラ絵と台詞をそのまま引っ張ってきた為の様です。調べるとかなりドぎついタイトルでのあられもない姿が拝めます。なんでそんなとこから引っ張ったんだ…乳輪がハミ出ているきわどいキャラが居るのも出典元がそういうゲームだからでしょう。もしキャラの容姿が気に入ったのならこんなゲームより原作を調べてそっちの購入を検討した方が良いでしょう。大人の方のみ。

●UIの不備
点数は左上のアイコンを押さないと見れません。捨て牌のツモ切りor手牌切りの識別表示がありません。他家が副露した面子は、
VIEW　MODEにいちいち移らないと見れません。サクサク進められるのは有難いですが、この辺にも利便性を重視してほしかったです。天鳳の様なネット麻雀を嗜んでいる方には、コレだけでも大きなマイナスでしょう。

●ルール設定＆バグ？
東風と東南。上がり止めや食い断の可否。赤ドラの有無。初期点数設定(10000～50000)といった基本的なルール変更は可能です。(裏ドラカンドラは適用で固定なので、いわゆる競技用ルールではプレイできません。注意しましょう。)流し満貫に十三不塔・人和・大車輪・四連刻といったローカル役満もいくつか設定可能です。ただし、「頭ハネ」と「南場のノーテン連荘」は固定です。これらに気に食わないという方もやめたほうが良いでしょう。
バグ？についてですが、ラス親でのアガリでトップと同点で2着になった所を強制的に上がり止めさせられました。上がり止めはラス親で「トップ」になれて初めて実行できるもののはずですが…また立直中のツモで待ちを狭くしてしまうカンができてしまう様です。できないのが共通ルールではないでしょうか。

●女の子達の打ち筋
はっきり言って、今時にしてはすっごく弱いです。総じてやる気が無いんじゃないかと疑うほど、アガる頻度が少ないです。鳴きも少ないし守りもできてません。３副露していてノーテン流局というケースすら何回もあります。まだ28半荘しか打ってないのに。マージャンゴッデスという大仰な異名もただの飾りです。「椎名るい」や「桜井あいり」と言った全ツッパ型は立直だけは積極的に打ってきますからそれなりに脅威ですが、まれに手変わりも待たずに一種０～２枚かつ安手という超愚形の待ちでも構わず打つという救い難い一面もあります。勿論、フリコミも積極的なので基本をおさえて打てば決して手強い相手ではありません。

●まとめ
ガワだけは立派ですが、中身がこんなんでよく2000円も取ろうと思いましたね。麻雀に合わせたボイスの新録も無しに、携帯アプリのゲームにエロゲーの素材を継ぎ接ぎする事でお手軽低コストで売り出し、あわよくば自社ゲームや使用元のエロゲーの宣伝を…という狙いでしょうか。辛辣な評価になりましたが、それだけフルプライスで買ってしまうと後悔するという事です。それでも欲しいと言う方は、遠慮なく大幅割引セールまで待ちましょう。

author: {'steamid': '76561198097309462', 'num_games_owned': 551, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1501484562}
review:
Sad the best PC mahjong game has balloon tit women with super high pitch voices. 

It's certainly not the best riichi mahjong game out there, but very acceptable. The play field is nice, the selecting and tossing of tiles is done with a mouse, it does highlight Tsumo/Ron/Chi/Pon/Kan opporunities, it even does a nice job of highlighting dora tiles, and matches can be set to a comfortable single wind amount of rounds. Also, while pretty exploitive, collecting all the girls does give you incentive to keep playing, and they all do have their own little quirks (some annoying, some cute). 

I dislike many of the names used for yaku and scoring. I'm so used to Japanese names that it's hard calling things a "slam" and a "run". While these are very English, much of the in-game titles are their Chinese counterparts(chow, pung, etc). I feel like the game should have selected one language (bias towards Japanese) and stuck with it. 

This AI seems fair enough. I feel like I don't get dealt as good a hand as other mahjong game software (rarely get two honors), but I do tend to win matches enough to feel good about it. This is a nice relief from the old arcade mahjong games which absolutely cheat and rob you. If anything, I'd maybe like to see an enhanced mode of sorts which allow items and/or abilities to increase luck, turn up all doras, allow you to see an opponent's hand, etc. Most console mahjong games have had these items and abilities thrown into them to make the game more enjoyable and interesting, shame to have it gone here. 

Also, if you're looking to learn mahjong, it's not happening here. I recommend learning how to play elsewhere, though, as mahjong is a fun game in general.

review:
This is the best (and only) non solitaire mahjong game on steam. That said its actually pretty good. The major caveat being that it teaches you nothing about how to play. (Also I could do without the "pretty girls" schtick tbh, its mildly embarassing but is pretty much just title screen fan service anyway).
I'm pretty sure I still have no idea how to play but I've managed to start winning fairly consistently (or at least not losing massively). I wish it had a more clear layout of what the possible winning hands are as I often seem to have a winning hand but get stuck in a loop of sacred discard. I think it has something to do with not having completed a yaku.
The game would greatly benefit from just a little static screen that shows the yaku and (and other hands?) like koi koi has. Obviously I can google that but I've got no real insight as to exactly which of the 4096 variants I'm actually playing here.

Anyway, if you want to suffer through learning how to play, already know how to play and want to play against AI, or just like reloading the title screen to look at anime girls, it's totally worth a sale buy.

review:
I guess the major point of the game is the amount of girls and their looks. But, even though that, this game actually plays surprisingly well.

You will need to know what to do, you need to know how to play Mahjong, to play this, but it actually does a pretty good job of monitoring the outcomes. It also helps you a lot, indicating when you can win and also pausing the game when a tile is played, something that does not occur in a normal game. So, the game actually makes it pretty easy for you.
Yet, the ai seems pretty strong sometimes, they can make some pretty good plays, finishing the game quick. You actually have to be careful.

From this game and the "school edition" there is no difference at all. You shouldn't buy both. Well, I don't actually recommend you to buy any, since I think that this game lacks a lot of content for its price. But, if you must play a good game of mahjong (only with AI), you may consider this...

author: {'steamid': '76561198005120813', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1637447298}
review:
This is perhaps the most poorly designed games I have ever played.

And no, it's not the mahjong that is poorly designed. Mahjong is an unimpeachable of spectacular fun.

It's the literal design choices in the user interface and the pacing of the AI.

Every single fucking transition in the game whenever a CPU 'pong's or 'chi's literally breaks the game's flow.
Every single screen that gets in the way between each round.
The inability to check the table after a match ends.
The need to drag your mouse around in order to see the other player's melds.
The shoddly 12fps animation in the title screen.
No animation for tile's being placed down. They just appear out of nowhere and it's distracting.
Annoying music.
Unresponsive interface.
The scrollbar in the settings screen for screen size does not correspond to how you drag the scroll bar, but rather the inner window.
Whenever you resize the window, the window literally freezes for a good 5 seconds. How hard is it to render mahjong tiles.

And not even 'pretty girls' can save this game. The characters literally have no character. While yes, they do have voice acting, but for what reason?
They aren't animated and furthermore, they have absolutely no backstory.
Honestly I would much rather play faceless bots.
I won't have to deal with the high pitched squeals, a transition in whenever a pon or chi happens, and comically oversized proportions (I'm looking at you Rui and Ayumi).
When you unlock characters, there's honestly no sense of accomplishment.

Couldn't even deliver a mahjong experience, let alone a character driven game.
If you understood Japanese I would direct you to the free ones that are available.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971532357', 'num_games_owned': 2752, 'num_reviews': 413, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1457258311}
review:
I love mahjong since I was a kid. However, I wasn't aware that two versions existed: the solitaire one, which is the version I love, and a sort of poker one, which I don't understand anything despite trying to decypher the rules in the help of the game.

True, I could have searched elsewhere but for me, the version presented here isn't interesting me. My brain isn't really strategy-oriented, which is why you don't ask me to play poker or other cards games if you're more interested by winning than to pass a good moment.

Mahjong Pretty Girls Battle could have been a good game for me if the rules were clear (they're not well translated) and if there was a real tutorial included. However, I ended up to play by instinct, which reserved sometimes a good suprise but almost all the time, I got defeated by the AI.

I suppose that for anyone used to this version of mahjong, the game is very enjoyable, though your only real visual is a board with the tiles. However, the characters are girls drawed for fanservice: some have big breasts (not really realistic), others are normal.

Besides, the soundtrack isn't remarkable but after a while, you'll get used to girls screaming because they have a winning move and you don't understand how they arrived to that.

My three hours ingame reflect mainly idling for cards, but I've giving up pretty quickly to try to understand the rules. I'm pretty happy with my solitaire version, which isn't requiring to plan carefully your next move (well, yeah, you have sometimes to plan carefully your move but you don't have adversaries in front of you, ready to take advantage of your discarded tile).

I should probably thumb down the game, however, I will not: the fact that I didn't really enjoy came from my lack of willingness to learn more about this version of Majhong. In that case, I recommend the game only for those that are understanding the rules of it.

review:
推荐打折买不推荐玩
缺点：
1.每个语音不超过3句（笑起来像吃错药），立绘不超过2幅。没18X更别说爆衣，赢多少局也没有。
2.AI纸张，全求人吃碰了一看像混一色的牌，最后大吊车了一张索子。
3.立直、吃碰、和牌的动画不能跳过，回头想看别人的副露还要扒拉一下桌子。
4.你都1280p了，牌山没有，看别人的副露还要扒拉一下桌子。
5.任何时候，不知道怎么就扒拉到桌子上了，画面来回闪。
6.作为一个纸张AI麻将一般都用比较爽的牌或者能力可以弥补一下给你点错觉，然而没有。
6续.比如好不容易小四喜字一色听牌被断幺。
7.点数需要扒拉左上角才能看见，需退出点数才能继续打牌，不能永久显示。
8.看不出摸切，扒拉桌子也不好使。
9.局中只能中断，不能sl，没联机模式，役种记录里的一票役都没法演。
10.和了结算前本场数迷之看不见。分数结算没有符数显示。
11.除非立直，没有自动摸切选项。
12.游戏内帮助没有役种表，对新手比较不友好。
总而言之，感觉上有点鸟笼的影子，最大提供1280p的分辨率却做出了手游一样的布局，比如扒拉桌子。
优点：
1.普通版校园版两个游戏，打折的时候都卖4块钱，还掉卡，卡每张能卖9毛，可以掉5张。
2.立绘奶子都很大。
挂完卡我就删游戏，这波不亏。

review:
作为一个日本麻将游戏这款游戏是不合格的。
作为一个看球游戏这款所谓的麻将游戏更是不合格。
单单从麻将上来说，对于日本麻将最重要的就是排位，而排位是由分数决定的。但这个辣油并不能实时显示场均分数，鸣牌动作的感觉也比其他麻将游戏感觉差很多。至于AI嘛，就是比新手还能狂日的AI，他家立直也敢狂日的主。至于AI的手役以门清为主，役牌为辅，几乎很难见到有食断的。AI进攻手段几乎就只有立直。
如果能看懂以上这段话的日麻爱好者，那这游戏可以考虑喜加二。如果是日麻初心者或者麻将初心者的话，那这游戏对你们基本上没有任何可玩点。或许唯一实用的地方就是可以挂卡。

review:
I'll say yes due to the price but if you've got no clue how to play Mahjong, this will not teach you.  I've been stumbling my way through using a guide to Mahjong in general but since I'm not sure why certain things are happening or how to adjust the rules to something that might be easier to play some games I end up more frustrated than anything else.

This game desperately needs a tutorial mode.  And I will admit I should have read the reviews before purchasing because of that fact.

The music is alright.  I've only unlocked one of the girls so no big info on that.  So far I don't find the voices hard to listen to.

I do like that it's very easy to play through a full game without a lot of time being consumed so it's a fast play if nothing else.

The tiles are very easy to read and the ability to 'view mode' simply by holding down the cursor on the table and moving the mouse helps see what has already been disguarded.

Not a game for beginners unless you're willing to do a lot of trial and error.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021271307', 'num_games_owned': 750, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1445053586}
review:
스팀 플랫폼의 유일한 리치마작 게임인 마작 미소녀 배틀입니다.

장점
1. 스팀 유일의 리치마작 게임
정확히 따지면 스쿨 걸 에디션도 있어서 유이지만 어차피 스킨만 바꾼 수준이니 하나로 칩니다.
스팀으로 리치마작을 칠 수 있습니다. 그냥 스팀 창 라이브러리에 모인 게임 목록을 보고 흐뭇해하다가
오늘은 이걸 해볼까? 하고 리치마작을 칠 수 있는 겁니다.
아니면 내 라이브러리에 리치마작 게임도 있다고 만족감을 느낄 수 있습니다.

단점
1. 어중간한 미소녀물
씹덕내를 내려면 내든가, 아니면 쏙 빼서 담백한 마작 게임으로 만들어야 하는데
스탠딩 CG의 표정 바리에이션만으로 모든 컷인을 해결하고, 보이스는 종류가 매우 떨어집니다.
다양한 종류의 승리대사나 패배대사, 하다못해 치 뻥 깡 이런건 상황에 맞춰 외치도록 만들어야 하는 거 아닙니까?
근데 손발이 오그라드는 대사, 그것도 같은 거 하나 내내 치고 있으니 한시간이면 질려버리죠.

2. 의미가 없는 캐릭 선택
마작이라는 것은 기본적으로 패를 뽑는 행운에 따라 내용이 갈리긴 하지만 그래도 치는 스타일이란 게 있습니다.
본 작에서도 그것은 미약하게나마 구현한 듯 하지만 그 차이를 실감하기가 어려운 수준입니다.
그리고 난이도 조절이 없으면 초반 캐릭은 호구같이 터는 맛이 있어야하고 후반 캐릭은 프로 수준의 AI가 나와야하지 않습니까?
마작 여신 딱지가 붙은 캐릭이 기본 캐릭한테 배만 직격 맞고 토비되는 건 좀 그렇잖아요. 대체 뭐가 마작 여신입니까.
차라리 사키 마작 게임이 오컬트로 인해 망한 밸런스를 보여주더라도 캐릭터 마다 개성을 넣어줘서 캐릭터 게임으로선 더 좋군요.

3. 지들끼리 노는 AI
이것들, 플레이어의 유효패는 귀신같이 피하는 주제에 지들끼리는 만관을 사이좋게 주고받습니다.
그러니까 플레이어의 손패는 나름 읽으려고 하는데 같은 AI한테는 관심이 없어서, 유효패를 걍 내버리는 거 같더군요.
하다보면 AI 셋이서 3인 마작하고 자신은 버려진 패나 모아서 역 만드는 거 같은 소외감을 느낍니다.
뭐 운빨이 좋아서 제 대신 다 쏘여준걸지도 모르... 기는 개뿔 1위한테 점수 헌납하고 들통나서 역전도 못하게 하면 어떡해

4. 쓸데없이 불편한 인터페이스
이 게임은 미묘하지만 3D로 되어 있어서, 상대의 나끼 패를 다시 보려면 마우스로 조작을 해야합니다.
왜 이렇게 불편하게 만든겁니까. 그냥 화면에 전부 표시하면 확인하기도 편하고 좋잖습니까.
게다가 프레임은 쓸데없이 20언저리에 고정되어서 버벅이는 듯한 느낌을 느껴야 합니까.

5. 멀티플레이 부재
하다못해 IP치고 들어가는 방식이라도 만들든가, 없어서 싱글플레이로 고만고만한 AI를 계속 상대해야 합니다.


결론

author: {'steamid': '76561198133760952', 'num_games_owned': 726, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1446108479}
review:
先说一句,这游戏的所有优点你都能从商店页面看到了,这篇评测只谈缺点.
本人打了两年多日麻,虽然还是鶸,但是至少还是知道什么程度算可以接受的.
打了不到一个小时就打不下去了.
这游戏的AI没有防守,跟完全不防的对手打日麻,很快就没意思了,更何况还是虐AI.
这个水平的AI也就可以当当新人的对手了,但是这游戏又没有任何对新手友好的设计,英文的役种翻译更加是不熟悉的人根本搞不明白.
如果是刚接触日麻个人推荐一个名叫KEITEN的游戏,有非常详细的针对新手的教程,还可以找到汉化.
因为没有联机功能,这游戏的全部意义就变成暴打智障AI...
那还远远不如东方幻想麻雀的一人打,虽然AI也挺智障但是有人物技能还有不同场地效果,至少玩的开心,而且音乐质量完全不在一个水平.
还有一点个人完全没法接受的,你一个定价15刀的日麻游戏居然连是不是手切都看不出来?!
定价1.5刀看不了手切摸切都可以算论外了,真的不知道15刀这个定价是哪里来的勇气.
一般游戏都是用灰色的牌表示摸切,正常颜色表示手切,或者通过做一个每一打从摸牌到打牌的动画来表示牌是从手牌中打出还是摸牌即打(这样你想读牌的话就不能光看牌河要自己记手切).
总之就是有不同的手段表示出手切摸切但是这游戏就是没有做,相当于在打的时候少了个很重要的信息.
所以个人感觉这个日麻游戏的日麻成分...几乎没什么意义
所以别买!一折也别买!进包也别买!
想打日麻找个别的游戏,想跟我打可以上天凤,想看妹子去玩别的日呆游戏.
想喜+1或者合卡的...请当做没看见这篇评测

review:
Se voce quiser comprar muito mesmo esse jogo, pague apenas quando tiver 3 dolares... pra nao se arrepender(muito) depois

Ok! Regras Japonesa e etc etc etc.... Eu semprei joguei O mahjong japones e sempre gostei de toda sua complexidade em relacao aos outros. Mas mesmo pra alguem que goste de MOE/ANIME/BOOBS ainda assim eu nao recomendo que voce ompre esse jogo. Pra comecar existem somente 4 personagens de inicio, pra habilitar o resto voce tem que vencer inumeras vezes em primeiro lugar, o que nao seria muito facil SE EXISTISSE um modo story. De fato fica bem chato logo nas primeiras horas, dai pra descobrir que tem que jogar muito pra habilitar as outras personagens. Nao tem modo torneio, nao tem absolutamente nada. Apenas o jogo e mais as vozes.
Segunda coisa eh que se houvesse pelo menos o modo multiplayer, isso salvaria a pele do jogo. O player nao sente motivado pra jogar porque existem jogos em flash online gratuitos pra jogar online, sem contar sites que contem avatar e graficos bem modernos. 

As partes boas sao as vozes e as imagens das personagens...

review:
初心者には向きません　システムが不親切過ぎます　
残り牌数の表記やアガリ牌表記が無い為いつの間にか立直可能状態又は残り牌無しテンパイ又はフリテン状態になるでしょう
そしてこの手の麻雀には必ずある中央の点数表記が左上の画面切り替えで一々見る方式になっているのでコレもストレス　しかも切り替えが遅い
オーラス（最後）が東4局になっているのでやはり初心者には少し聞き慣れてない言葉が出ます

肝心のCPUの弱さは無茶苦茶弱いです　接待麻雀レベル　途中やっててコレやってると自分弱くなるな…位
大抵フリテンしてのツモ狙いや狙った役からの偏った捨て方をする為（あっ…ここ辺りが当たり牌だな）と上手い人なら大抵読める位弱いです
その為ツモ以外他のCPUが放銃します　なので役満狙うとCPUの立直1役で局流れ[strike] 返して久々の国士13面待ち! [/strike]
しかも殆どが1翻で積んだ数え満貫　たまーに七対子　倍満以上を出すCPUが殆ど居ません　殆どのキャラは即リーチ棒投げちゃうし　
今ならこれ以上の麻雀物は多数有るため90%の値引きでなければ買わなかったと思います
ですが初心者向けでは無いとは言いましたが逆に捨て牌やテンパイ警告が無い為初心者の練習用にもなります　がその前に大抵他面子が放銃する為練習にならないぐぬぬ…
ユーザーレビューの賛否両論は言い得て妙だと思いました　今回はキャラクターのアンロックが壮絶に面倒な為（特に20個の役）オススメしないの方にさせて貰います

後余談ですが英語訳の役名って格好いいんですね結構…

review:
Disclaimer: I bought this when it was 90% off (for about $1.50)

The simplified translation might turn some people off, but it doesn't really bother me. Putting "Call" instead of "Riichi" (which doesn't really have an English translation, but sounds like "reach") for example, or the Chinese "Chow", "Pung", and "Kong", instead of the more Japanese "Chi", "Pon" and "Kan". It also says "Slam" instead of "Mangan", or any of the other hand value names.

My favorite feature is that when you have declaired riichi, the game will play itself until someone wins, or the game ends in a draw. Auto-discard is nice and speeds up the endgame. It is also nice that the tiles are big on the screen.

I usually play a free flash game, when I want to play single-player Mahjong, but for $1.50, this was a nice purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141499183', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1487618416}
review:
※麻雀は昔に一時期やっただけであまり詳しくないので、用語は怪しいかも知れません。

半荘三回打ちましたが、それだけで「これ明らかに裏で確率いじってるな」ってわかります。

順子、刻子、役牌が３枚ほぼ連続で来たりする。それはもう白けるレベルで。
それは敵側も同じらしく、８巡目までにはほぼ必ず一人はリーチする。
そして５巡目以内には必ずロンかツモる。
三回半荘打って、２回しか流局しませんでした。というか、１５巡以上まわることもほとんどなかったです。

こういったエロ系麻雀では確率操作するのはよくありますが、
ここまであからさまなのも珍しいです。
他家の和了が早すぎるので、こちらはその前に和了らなければならず、
「早あがりするか、デカい役を狙うか」といった選択肢がないです。

他のレビューにもあったので予期していましたが、予測を上回るレベルで演出がうざい。
リーチ　→　女の子カットイン　→　カメラがリーチした家の方を向く　→　リーチ棒出現
→　リーチ棒がくるくる回りながらゆっくりと中央に着地　→　一瞬時間が止まる　→　ゲーム再開

あと、ボイス回りも酷い。
ボイス音が小さい。コンフィングでＳＥとＢＧＭの音量設定はあるのに、なぜかボイスの音量設定はない。
ボイスが、元ネタのゲームからそのまま流用してるのか、麻雀に関係ないことばかりしゃべって、
意味が全然通じない。
コギャル（死語？）が和了って、「あいつらちょ～うぜぇんだけどぉ」とか意味が分からん。
また、セリフは基本煽り系（「さっさと消え失せなさ～いｗ」とか）なので、地味にイラっとくる。

確率操作のせいで、麻雀ゲームをやっているのではなく出来レースを走らされてる感じで、
駆け引きがまったくなく、つまらない、の一言です。
というか、麻雀というすでに完成されているテーブルゲームをここまでつまらなくするのは、
ある意味ですごいです。
適当にやれる麻雀ゲームが以前から欲しかったので、
９０％ＯＦＦセールで買いましたが、それでもおすすめできないです。

※麻雀未経験者で、このゲームで覚えようかなと思っている人へ
絶対に止めておいたほうがいいです。
このゲームは駆け引きも戦略もなく、麻雀の醍醐味が全部死んでます。
「麻雀ってこんなものなの？」と麻雀を勘違いしてしまいます。

author: {'steamid': '76561198001163877', 'num_games_owned': 1660, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1444142149}
review:
アンインストールして天鳳をやりましょう









とぶん投げるのは楽だが、少しはきちんと（どこがダメか）書こう。
・全体的に動作がもっさり
　ロードにえらく時間がかかる、と言った類ではないが感覚的に奇妙なモッサリ感がある。
　（環境のせいかもしれないので理由は不明）

・問題のある解像度の変更
　解像度の変更には時間が掛かるし、オプション画面に留まらず何故かメニュー画面に戻される。

・リーチ時のCPU速度を変更できない
　デフォルトだと一瞬でCPU３人の処理が終わるが、個人的にはせて敗はゆっくり見たいので速度を「遅い」に変更した。
　自分がリーチした時くらいは速度を早められるだろうと考えていたが、全くそんなことはなかった。
　もしかしたら速度を変更するショートカットキーがあるかもしれないとも思ったが、公式のマニュアルを読んだところそれもない。

・キャラ性能
　キャラ差があったとしても、それを実感できるほどこのゲームを続けるのは無理だ。

　雀龍門かハンゲの麻雀をやるほうがマシだな！

　てかこれスマホゲーム無理やり移植したようにしか見えないぞ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198010363485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1463869631}
review:
以-90%的低價入手合輯，價格很便宜，也有交換卡片，看起來好像很不錯？

但是我相當不推薦入手這系列的作品（儘管遊戲我開不到10分鐘）



如果你只是想要讓你的Steam Library增加一款或兩款遊戲，那麼你可以等特價-90%或更低價，亦或是等到入包時再買



這遊戲缺點太多了......

首先，這兩款系列作其實只能說是一款作品，因為兩款作品差別只在於遊戲的角色和交換卡片的圖案設計

另外，操作上有些卡卡的，操作起來並不是很順暢

然後是沒有圖形選項可以選，你僅能選擇畫面解析度和是否要視窗化

完全沒有打麻將的感覺，而是一種難以言喻的作業感

只能跟NPC玩，不但沒有故事模式，也沒有多人連線，這算什麼麻將遊戲？內容太過貧乏了...

AI不強，以我那爛牌技，第一局就胡牌了

我不否認是因為有役牌三張發加快了胡牌的速度，但是像雀龍門的AI就強多了......



如果你想玩日麻，你有很多選擇

像是免費的天鳳、後來改為付費的雀龍門，甚至是同人社團的東方幻想麻雀系列（遊戲要花錢買）等

這系列作品跟上述那幾款作品一比，實在上不了檯面.....



喔，對了，忘了說玩家們最在乎的FPS表現了

在遊戲中，FPS是維持在21~22之間

review:
Okay, yes the selling point is the boobs, but I, being ace, get nothing out of them, so I actually bought it for the game. Also this review applies for the school girl version as well, just replace "boobs" with "tiny mini-skirts"

I'm a pretty avid fan of Cantonese-rules mahjong, and this game is pretty similar. However, I cannot recommend this game unless you already have at least a basic understanding of how to play the game - because this game just dumps you in there like a crazed scout leader, and if you don't know what you're doing, you'll lose quickly before you figure out how to play.

The game does toss you a few life-rings here and there, however. It will prompt you if you can call to pick up, or declare preparedness (it makes sense in context), and it will auto-sort. It won't let you move the cards around manually though - most won't mind that, but I, and the guy from Hong Kong who taught me how to play, often depend on doing that, so yeah...

The rules are actually extremely varied too - you can set all sorts of rules, such as your starting bank, what bonus cards are active, and even certain melds and hands. For a simple execution, it's very detailed in its guts.

The camera angle is stupid - set it to over-head or you'll miss what's being discarded - also, you can't ever see the whole table, so you need to move it around - it's not difficult, but it's very annoying to have to continuously do

And yeah, the boobs. ...If the reason you're buying this is to look lewdly at girls, I'd recommend getting something different. Go troll tsumino or something.

review:

言归正传，作为一个纯娱乐向的人机麻将游戏玩家，打着动漫相关旗号的麻将游戏也玩过不少。简要写一下我对这游戏的看法：

优点： 大部分角色看着还算顺眼（其实我不喜欢胸太大的，太不自然==）作为一款日麻游戏操作还算流畅，电脑出牌速度尚可，不用等（我真玩过出牌速度慢的一比的游戏...）游戏里面有成就系统，只是意义不大。游戏界面分辨率是可调的，适应不同尺寸的屏幕。人物解锁其实可以看成一个游玩要素吧，基本上刷刷刷就能解锁所有人。当然对于某些人反而是缺点啦。游戏难度的话我觉得还好，作为渣渣人机党，胜率还是能超过平均水平的：） 不同角色的出牌策略会有差异这点还是要赞一下的。虽然区分的种类很有限。

缺点： 首先如有些人说的那样一旦切到别的程序再回来的时候会出现卡顿，虽然很快能恢复但是确实影响游戏体验。音乐略单调，立绘只有表情而且只有在立直荣和自摸的时候有变化结束的时候都没有==声音也一样如果在和牌时能报役名就好了。像大部分日麻游戏一样没有基本玩法介绍，只有先知道基本规则才能上手这款游戏，好在日麻基本规则不算太难，如果大家玩过国内的麻将的话，对于老外嘛，呵呵。没有多人是个遗憾，虽然这游戏有多人模式大部分时候也是鬼服，不过最起码还是应该支持局域网。

总结： 如果要我打分的话我大概会给它打个7.5吧。 基本分6分外加steam 第一款日麻游戏加成。相较而言PC上我更推荐东方的麻将，可玩性比这个高。psp上的话我就推荐玩天麻了233

author: {'steamid': '76561197985926092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1388, 'last_played': 1451811847}
review:
It's crap. 

But it's weirdly charming. 

The translation is laughably bad-- 1.5 Slam!! Humanly Hand!! 25,000 Bones!!-- but it's not too hard to follow. Granted, since I'm already really into mahjong, I could play it even in Japanese. But really, there's no point in buying this game if you're not already really into mahjong. 

That's the crux of it: this game has an incredibly niche appeal. If you're into riichi mahjong, and you like laughing at bad translation, and you like pretty anime girls, then this is the game for you. It's only worth it for the novelty value. Even the girls themselves are pretty laughable, with their utterly ludicrous outfits, but some of them are kind of charming and the voice acting is... something. Though I find myself wishing that they'd just say 'pon' and 'chi' rather than spitting out the same long line over and over again. 

It's as barebones as it comes. It has a good amount of rule options, but it's just 4-player mahjong with 2, 4, or 8 rounds. Moderately challenging, but that's it. It's completely spartan. Nothing else to it. The only thing that makes it even halfway compelling is the staggering requirement for unlocking characters; you have to place 1st a certain amount of times with the one before them in the column, meaning that overall you have to win something like 84 games to get all the non-goddess characters. The Goddesses themselves are much harder, with one requiring you to win with 20 different types of hands, and one requiring you to place 1st a hundred times, though their offensively absurd skimpy outfits limit their appeal. 

Okay, so that doesn't really make it sound very good. Because it isn't. But for all of its bad translation, lack of key features-- yeah, no multiplayer, which makes it utterly pointless as a steam game, /especially/ for the outrageous $15 price tag-- and ridiculous designs, I can't bring myself to hate it. It's just so strange and funny that it's oddly charming. The music's not bad, the art is pretty nice, there's lots of voice acting and what's more, I got a really funny stream out of it. I'm really hoping that this release will pave the way for more mahjong games on steam in the future. 

TL;DR: IF YOU LIKE MAHJONG, PRETTY GIRLS, AND BATTLE, AND YOU DON'T MIND IT BEING RATHER SILLY AND LIGHT ON FEATURES, THEN... WAIT UNTIL IT'S ON SALE.

review:
没有中文评测，我就来评测下。
首先不推荐不会日麻的玩家购买，可能你吃着吃着，碰着碰着，就没办法胡了。这不是BUG，这是日麻的规则，没有役是不能胡的。
其次初始角色都是巨乳，制作组到底有多喜欢巨乳啊魂淡！解锁新角色还必须用上一轮的角色拿到第一名才行解锁，晕巨乳的玩家慎入。
另外感觉AI比较强，虽然没有和真人打的感觉，但是也够吃一壶的了。
感觉这款游戏很照顾性急的玩家，因为出牌需要点两下才行，防止这张牌这巡就想着要丢，结果下巡来了个搭子或者将子，可以有效的防止还没看清楚这巡的牌，就那上巡不打算要的牌给丢掉。
其实这款游戏我个人觉得应该是中评，但是苦于这是steam上少有的麻将游戏，就给个好评算了。
在加上一句，南四我领先20000分，硬是被流局流到11本场，庄家流局不听牌还继续连庄，最后11本场被AI完成二打一大逆转掉到第四位。脾气不好的玩家慎入这款游戏！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561197993227263', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1426412576}
review:
Для начала... правила игры на русском языке: http://tesuji-club.ru/osnovi-pravil-riichi - настоятельно рекомендую ознакомться с ними перед покупкой игры, во-первых, потому что игра существенно сложнее, чем кажется, во-вторых, потому что есть то же самое, но бесплатно да еще и онлайн против живых противников!

Технические моменты. Первый. На windows 7 и 8.1 игра у меня запустилась без всяких манипуляций с настройками языков и регионов. Второй. Данная игра - это порт на PC игры MahJong Nagomi, доступной, в apple store и в google play. Уровень графики соответствующий.

Интерфейс. Он плох. Вы не видете открытые сеты других игроков и свои, а также 4-й ряд дискарда в конце раздачи. Приходится постоянно двигать камеру и осматриваться, что крайне неудобно. Отключить цифровые подписи на тайлах тоже не получится.

Настройки правил стола (Play -> Rules Set). Советую сразу включить нормальное окончание игры (самая первая опция), т.к. по умолчанию игра будет продолжаться до тех пор, пока в орасу не выиграет кто-то, кроме дилера, даже если он на первом месте! Также тут можно управлять ака-дорами и куитаном. И в общем то всё. Да, можно включить ренхо, нагаси манган, устаревшие якуманы: дайшарин, суренко, сисанпуту и т.п., но то же куикаэ, например, настроить нельзя. Не густо короче.

Общие настройки (кнопка Config в главном меню). Обязательно установите Wait в Normal - это скорость игры. По умолачнию почему-то она максимальная и абсолютно невозможно понять, что происходит. Также советую установить Tile discard в Release - достаточно будет одного клика для сноса, настройка по умолчанию явно перекочевала в неизменном виде из версии для сенсорных экранов.

Ачивки. Сделаны не через стим, а внутри игры. Почти все они скучны: сыграть 10/100 раз, выиграть 10/100 раз по цумо/рон, выиграть 10/100 игр и т.п.

Противники. Для открытия девочек нужно быть первым от 3 до... 100 раз! Впрочем, сложных для открытия персонажей всего три, всех остальных вы получите уже после 10 побед. У каждой девочки свой стиль игры, основанный на скорости сбора рук, стоимости рук и уровне защиты. Разумеется, из-за этого каждая имеет и слабости, которыми вам, очевидно, нужно пользоваться, чтобы повысить свои шансы на победу. Никакого сюжета здесь, увы, нет, реплики девочек с японского не переведены, поэтому насладиться их характерами вам не удастся - только писклявыми голосами и сиськами от 3-го размера.

Сложность. Проблем у опытного игрока с ботами не будет, другое дело, что опытные вряд-ли станут тратить время на эту игру, а вот начинающим придется непросто, особенно, если они еще даже не знают что такое пайри и бетаори.

Итог. Не смотря на все недостатки, это единственная версия риичи-маджонга в стиме, соответственно, как большой энтузиаст данной игры я ставлю ей "Да"... до тех пор, пока в стиме не появится лучшей версии.

review:
Joten, tässä on tällä hetkellä (kun kirjoitan tätä) niin ainut Japanilainen Riichi Mahjong -peli, minkä voit ostaa n. 15 eurolla.

Minusta tämä peli on todella keskiverto verratuna muhin selainpohjaisiin vaihtoehtoin mitä löytyy mm. Tenhou ja muut. Voin sanoa että maksulliseksi peliksi tämä on aika heikko. Ei mitään erikoista. Tietenkin tämä on minusta paras vaihtoehto jos haluat opettaa pelin avulla ystäviäsi pelaamaan mahjongia. Uskon että pystyt pienellä avustuksella ja kertomalla peruskäsiä niin opettamaan helposti miten Riichi Mahjongia pelataan.

Yhtenä hienona puolena tässä pelissä on se että voit säätää säännöt oman maun mukaan. Esim. Itse vihaan pelata avoimella tanyaolla, mutta joitakin tiettyjä tissieläimiä vastaan tässä pelissä se on suositeltavaa. Katson sinua Mahjong Goddess.

Tietenkin jos haluat enemmän iloa irti niin suosittelen mielummin käymään Tenhoussa vaikka sen UI on nihonia, mutta haluan puolustaa tätä peliä sillä että jos sinulla ei ole mahdollisuuttaa usein käydä netissä tai muuten vain nettiyhteydet pätkii niin suosittelen harkitsemaan tätä peliä. Vaikka se ei ole häävi niin minusta sillä saa pahimmat Mahjong riippuvuudet tyydytettyä.

Onko tässä muuta sisältöä? Ei oikein. Suurin osa on sitä että sä valitset pelattavan hahmon ja koitat voittaa tarpeeksi pelejä että saat lisää hahmoja. Voi että. Muutenkin tämä peli on mielestäni suunnattu enemmän pelaajille jotka tietää perusasiat mahjongista, mutta ei ihan asiantuntija tasoa.

Yksi asia tässä vielä on mikä minua häiritsee. Nää naisten tissien koot. Siis oikeasti. Kyl mä ymmärtäisin jos tää ois tyylin joku Harem/Visual Novel/Hentsu peli jossa sä pääset noiden naisten pöksyihin jos sä voitat tietyn verran pelejä. Tietenkin pelkästää nää naiset vaan on oikeasti silmäkarkkia niille pienille Jarno Petteri 13 veelle joka just on löytäny Naruton ja haluu kattoo anime naisten tissejä.

Mutta tl;dr

Peli on ihan 3/5 kokemus jota on hauska pelata illan pikkutunneilla kun ei oo mitään muutakaan tekemistä.

review:
I actually was looking for a mahjong game worth buying.  Unfortunately this is pretty much a tablet/phone app translated to PC and not a whole lot of effort made in the conversion.  If you haven't learned the basics of Mahjong then you're going to be clueless (e.g. Dodger's video on Youtube of this game).  If you have the basics down, you're still kinda playing blind but at least you have an idea of how to win.  

For those who don't know: The game is pretty much like Rummy.  You have to build "melds" that consist of 3 of a kind (Pung), 4 of a kind (Kong) or a run of 3 tiles in sequence (Chow).   So you need 4 sets of melds (Kong, Pung, or Chow) and 1 set of two to win.  The last tile you draw is not discarded and needed to "go out".

You can take tiles from the person to your left to make a "Chow" meld or you can be take from anyone to make a pung or kong meld.  The other players can do the same (naturally) so you really need to be thinking about what you throw away as much as what you take.  There's also a bonus to be earned from NOT taking any tiles from anyone, winning on a self-drawn tile rather than taking from someone else, and also a bonus if you call "riichi" and then win the hand (it's like throwing an extra 1000 points into the pot saying that you're about to win).

I've probably got some of the rules wrong because I'm not a hardcore player, but if you had no idea how to play and you're reading this, you now at least know a bit more.  I hope you bought the game for the mahjong because the characters are pretty bland.  

I learned how to play Mahjong from watching Akagi (an anime) and from playing a few other freebie mahjong games.  While the presentation on this game is better than the freebies in some ways, in other ways it's lacking.

Things that could have made this game better:
[list]
[*]multiplayer
[*]more characters to start with
[*]a basic ruleset to teach beginners
[*]an advanced tutorial to teach intermediate players
[*]an interface that does NOT seem like it was made for tablets or phones.
[*]better voice acting/less annoying voice acting.
[*]a slower pace so you can see what's going on (for the beginners)
[/list]

[code]
That's just a short list of things they could do to improve this.  

Don't buy this if you're not a fan of mahjong.  Even if you ARE a fan of Mahjong, you may want to rethink this.[/code]

Прикольный, милый, чересчур даже сисястый))) Однако сложные оппоненты, чёрт этих девчонок за их выпуклости!)

Игра только на одного игрока, надеюсь в будущем будет функция онлайн-партий с другими игроками. Сюжета, кампании нету вовсе. Играем за девушек, чаще выирываем - открываются новые персонажи. В выборе девушек условия их открытия написаны.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006799260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1596216243}
review:
Pros:
- The only riichi (Japanese) mahjong game available on Steam localized into English
- There are different characters, and each CPU comes with a set playstyle. Also, different voices!

Neutral Remarks:
- Only those who already know at least the basic rules of Japanese mahjong can play this game, yet it still translates some of the terms these players should be familiar with into English which IMO puts me off. ALTHOUGH the translations of the winning configurations (yaku) are welcome.
Examples:
[*]Call → [i]Riichi[/i]
[*]Pung → [i]Pon [/i]
[*]Chow → [i]Chi[/i]
[*]Win (appears if you draw the tile) → [i]Agari/Tsumo[/i]
[*]Also the names for Mangan, Haneman, etc.


Cons:
- [b]No multiplayer![/b] ← EMPHASIS ON THIS!
- The interface itself is clunky and not smooth as compared to other games.
- It's missing a lot of features already present in other games (albeit those games are in Japanese):
[*]Showing what tiles you're going to win with
[*]Identifying if a person's tiles are discarded right after draw (tsumogiri)


Essentially, the game is single player mahjong on a PC platform. I don't know about you, but for me playing against CPUs gets considerable boring over time. If you want to practice playing, I guess you could buy this game, but in terms of features, it is a bit pricey (considering there are free web versions of this).

All in all, this feels like an old Japanese mahjong game that has just been ported to Steam. It's lacking features for its price. 

If you're a veteran: just stick with web clients like Tenhou. 
If you're trying to get into this game: I would also recommend the above as you'll probably improve more playing elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020825802', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 2555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2170, 'last_played': 1456892231}
review:
Mahjong Pretty Girls Battle is nothing else than a simple japanese version of the Mahjong game.....with anime girls.


For all of you who stayed to read a more "complex" review of this game...well...as complex as you can get about a game of mahjong anyways, here is what you will get.

First of all, the whole mahjong game it self works deceantly, which is good because other than that, there is nothing much really.

The whole anime side of the game, is like a nice sticker on something plain, so you can try and make it look unique. The girls talk in japanese but they all have 3 or 2 lines total, which gets pretty repetitive and the fact that some of the girls sound pretty annoying too, doesnt help either. The music doesn't really fit the whole game either. Thankfully you can mute every sound or the two individually in the options menu if you want to.

Other "minor" problem with the game is that the translation is pretty bad....yeah...never would have thought that I'm  ever going to mention translation issues in a mahjong game...but on the upside, it can make you chuckle for the first time you read it.

Since there is no multiplayer in the game (Which is a real shame) the only thing you can do is to unluck all the different characters in the game, which is just like unlocking different AI behaviours.

One last thing I want to mention is that there is no tutorial in the game. So if you are new to mahjong, this isnt where you wanna start getting in to it, or download a manual from the internet before you hop in to the game.


Overall, the game lacks originality. The girls it self are nothing more than different AI's with different behaviours. It would have been cool if all the girls would have different special moves like I dont know, switching tiles, super mega lucky draws etc. but no unfortunatelly all you have is a basic mahjong game with anime stickers on it.

As for do I recommend it or not, well.....it deppends on why do you want to buy it. If you want a solid mahjong game with  some basic anime skin on it, than yes. This game is good to sit down for an hour and play a few rounds than get back to your life. For people who would want something unique, I would say try and look for one online.

review:

この「Mahjong Pretty Girls Battle」（マージャン プリティー ガールズ バトル）」はあの数々の海外PCゲームローカライズやパブリッシングを手掛けた「ZOO」によるSteam初参入作品の麻雀ゲームである。

・マルチプレイ非対応

・進行状況によって新しいプレイアブル or CPUキャラクターがアンロック
と正直うーん、と思ってしまう出来ではあるが、登場してくる女の子はオリジナルではなく、他社からライセンスを受けた「エロゲーのキャラクター」の模様。
ああ・・・ZOOよ、MAFIAやHIDDEN & DANGEROUS 2をローカライズしていたあの硬派だった時代はなんだったのか・・・
荒井由実（松任谷由実）の「卒業写真」が脳内で流れつつ、夢幻戦士ヴァリスがヴァリスXでエロゲーになってしまった時のような衝撃が再び蘇ってくる。
悲しいかもしれないが、これも時代の流れなのかもしれない。それは誰にも変えることができない。
ZOOや今は亡きサイバーフロントが手掛けた数々のローカライズ作品をプレイしながら「洋ゲー最高！和ゲーはオワコン！」と騒いでいたあの頃の思い出に浸りつつ、麻雀しながらブヒブヒするのであった。

author: {'steamid': '76561197969418821', 'num_games_owned': 3864, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1555727266}
review:
First of all, the game gives an error when starting the game, but it continues to run. If I go into the options menu however, I get a DirectX error, and it crashes the game completely. It's still fully playable though, I just can't see what options there are.

It's four player mahjong, and moves at a satisfyingly fast pace. I say this because a lot of four player mahjong video games are excrutiatingly slow. 

The default setting in this game is for four rounds (east only), rather than the eight (east and south) or sixteen (east, south, west, north) variants you usually get in these games, so games fly by really quickly.

The sound effects are great, and to summarise, the actual mahjong gameplay part is fun!

---

Unfortunately... there's not much else to say about the game other than things that can be perceived as downsides.

- When you lose, it dumps you back to the title menu.

- When you WIN, it dumps you back to the title menu.

- There's no kind of 'reward art' that tends to be common in these kinds of games.

- There's no character dialogue or in-between-game scenes, just different voices during the mahjong gameplay.

- Characters unlock on an achievement basis, ie. 'Win 100 games!' or 'Win 5 games as this character!' This isn't bad in itself, but when it's the only thing in the game to work towards (getting different voice samples and a character icon), it's not too motivating. 

- It's single player only, but honestly, that's usually the norm for these kinds of anime-themed mahjong games... except all the other single player mahjong games usually have a storyline, dialogue, reward art, endings, occasionally heart meters, and so on. This game has none of those.

In short, it's great for a ten minute burst of polished fast-paced mahjong gameplay, but don't expect anything more than that. There's no goal to aim for other than unlocking all the characters, and those characters are nothing more than a single picture when choosing them on the character select screen, and then you never see them again.

Purely because it's the only way to play mahjong in English on Steam, and the gameplay part is solid, I'm clicking 'Recommended' for this!  But if you are able to play Japanese console games, there are hundreds of better titles out there in this genre.

UPDATE: No one should buy this now, https://mahjongsoul.yo-star.com/


---THIS GAME IS FOR HARDCORE MAHJONG PLAYERS ONLY---

If you are not familiar with how Ricchi Mahjong is played this game WILL NOT TEACH YOU HOW TO PLAY IT. 

The game is Mahjong, the bass techno music is horrible but beside the sound... its mahjong that’s it. If you want to play Riichi Mahjong on your PC/Steam then this is the game, and the ONLY game to get. (You can get the Japanese tenhou client and play mahjong on your PC that way but... tenhou requires some work the complex UI can be intimidating as everything is in Japanese and is filled with bots, its mainly for and used by the Japanese and Chinese community) 

If you're expecting something fancy then you've come to wrong place. The translation is absolutely horrible, nothing makes sense in English, I've just turned the UI into Japanese because now I'm not going get annoyed from the engirishi. 

The feel of the actual play, the game play is nice, it’s what to be expected from a Mahjong game released on Steam by one of the big Japanese companies, it’s just very sad that the game is singe-player only and there are no current talks or plans for online support.

 With all that said the game supports a huge roaster of characters, you only have 4 unlocks at first the rest are unlocked by your progression. Hm… well yeah that’s sums it up I guess, worth mentioning that some users are reporting issues with the game (crashes, missing graphical objects) you might want to wait before making a purchase although it seems the developer of the game is active on the Steam forums so I guess they're on it and chances are these issues are going to handled quite nicely. 

UPDATE:  http://steamcommunity.com/games/338060/announcements/detail/243527024526691800

Running on Win7 64bit 8Gb Ram 1600X900 5850HD Graphics.  

EDIT: A lot of people seem to be confused on what this game actually is, there are no hot anime chicks in this game, you don't talk to anyone, they don't say anything, its JUST Mahjong. With the addition of anime cardboard box cutouts as your opponents whom are almost NEVER ON SCREEN. (They show up to say Pon ,Ron, Kan, Chi, for a MICRO SECOND during the game, you're also shown the cardboard box image of the winning character at the after game score screen) 

I would personally give this game a +12 rating for its sexually? suggesting cardboard box cutout anime girls, that's it, it wouldn't even qualify for a +15 rating.
